analysis: The documents primarily concern the establishment, modification, and administration of Indian reservations. They involve setting aside land for the use and occupancy of various tribes, adjusting boundaries, and addressing specific issues like resource management (timber, fisheries) and infrastructure (railways, schools) within or adjacent to reservation lands. The documents span from the mid-19th to the early 20th century, reflecting evolving policies and interactions between the U.S. government and Native American tribes.
title: Indian Reservation Lands Management
